image.altText: Zak Crawley fends into the off side

props.synopsis: Mitchell Starc wastes little time before getting into his work as England's struggles continue despite Ben Stokes winning the toss and electing to bat first. Follow live.

title.children: England batters fight back after double Starc strike

image.altText: A close up of Penny Wong.

props.synopsis: The Coalition seizes on meeting notes from June to claim the government is working to return Australian children and partners of Islamic State fighters.

title.children: Wong will not say if further Islamic State family members on track to return

image.altText: Anika Wells looks in the distance in front of the National Press Club backdrop

props.synopsis: A mammoth year in politics ended with a focus on what is worrying most Australians ahead of Christmas: the cost of living.

title.children: Cost of living still a sore point for voters as politicians go on holiday

image.altText: A politician smiles while tickling a newborn baby in hospital

props.synopsis: With Australia's fertility rate at a new low and concerns about its economic impact on the future, the former treasurer behind the early 2000s baby boom says all options should be on the table to encourage more children.

title.children: Baby bonus father Costello wants falling fertility 'back on the agenda'

image.altText: A person and a car on the road at Glenlusk.

props.synopsis: Emergency bushfire warnings are issued for three Tasmanian communities — Glenlusk, near Hobart, Levendale in the state's south-east and Dolphin Sands on the east coast.

title.children: Three emergency bushfire warnings for Tasmania amid 100kph wind gusts

image.altText: A drone shot of an island

props.synopsis: Little St James is commonly referred to "Epstein Island" and according to attorneys for his accusers, the island was the site of many crimes committed against underage girls.

title.children: Locals called it 'Paedophile Island' but for Epstein it was 'perfect'

image.altText: A man poses for a photo

props.synopsis: Mejid Hamzy's murder sparked Sydney's deadliest gangland war in a generation. For two years what led to his demise has been a secret.

title.children: A Sydney chocolatier turned gangster, secret trials and the underworld war

image.altText: A man wearing dark sunglasses and a black jacket

props.synopsis: The South African neo-Nazi who sparked controversy during a protest outside NSW parliament has left Australia after his visa was revoked.

title.children: Neo-Nazi and family leave country after minister revoked visa

image.altText: Richard Marles and Pat Conroy press conference

props.synopsis: The acting prime minister says the United States is fully supportive of AUKUS and has thanked it for providing a review. Follow live.

title.children: Marles says he is 'working through' AUKUS review from the US

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The state and territory housing scorecard
Childcare 'spot checks' at 40 so far but 1,000 to come
Should Australia have backed up its 'mate' Japan in its China stand-off?

image.altText: A man smiles in a photo with coworkers

props.synopsis: Detectives have issued an additional 83 charges against Joshua Dale Brown, a former childcare worker who was charged with more than 70 offences earlier this year.

title.children: Alleged childcare paedophile Joshua Brown hit with further charges

image.altText: A young child holds a mobile phone with a padlock graphic embossed over the top.

props.synopsis: Today marks the unofficial start of the teen social media ban. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: The teen social media ban is here. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: An aerial view of a large sunny bay with a boat in the water

props.synopsis: A group of six foreign nationals are detained by authorities after two of their group were found in WA's remote Kalumburu community by an off-duty police officer.

title.children: Foreign nationals discovered in remote WA as ABF launch investigation

image.altText: Ted Egan pictured in front of a ghost gum.

props.synopsis: A former Government House occupant and a prolific author and historian, Ted Egan will also be remembered as the man who reinvented the beer box as a musical instrument.

title.children: Beer box musician and land rights champion: Ted Egan's 'big and generous life'

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: The judge presiding over the trial of Rajwinder Singh, accused of the 2018 murder of Toyah Cordingley, is summing up the case before the jury goes out to deliberate.

title.children: Jury in trial of man accused of Toyah Cordingley's murder told motive not key

image.altText: A digitally blended composite image comprised of people and the RBA

props.synopsis: A leading economist says the "risk" of an "imminent" RBA interest rate hike is "rising", while former treasurer Peter Costello is urging Australia to arrest its fertility downturn. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Risk of 'imminent' RBA rate hike rising

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Market expects September RBA rate hike but it could be sooner

image.altText: Medicine blister packs on a red surface.

props.synopsis: Health experts say tighter regulations around pregnancy supplements are needed as newer brands replace folic acid — a key nutrient shown to prevent birth defects — with a lesser-studied alternative.

title.children: What's in pregnancy supplements? Sorting science from marketing spin

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at press conference

props.synopsis: Despite holding a commanding position, Anthony Albanese knows the global trend of sliding trust in government isn't one to be taken lightly.

title.children: Three things show Albanese's score on trust and integrity

image.altText: AWU Queensland boss Stacey Schinnerl breaks down

props.synopsis: A rival union leader has broken down in tears at a Queensland inquiry while recounting how a CFMEU member publicly berated and harassed her in front of her 13-year-old son.

title.children: Rival union boss breaks down in tears at Queensland CFMEU inquiry

image.altText: dog and man on couch

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly misled police over the theft of his vehicle and family pet has been charged with driving offences and obstructing police.

title.children: Man who allegedly abandoned dog Arnie facing additional charges

image.altText: An old woman and man, both wearing glasses, sit on chairs around a round wooden table

props.synopsis: The family of the late first wife of High Country killer Greg Lynn says a fresh investigation into her death has stalled because police will not pay for an expert report.

title.children: Fresh probe into Lisa Lynn's death stalls over $9,000 bill, family says

image.altText: kevin wife homecare yard

props.synopsis: Care providers are trying to strongarm cash from suppliers of equipment, including wheelchairs, a month after the federal government reformed home care packages for senior Australians.

title.children: 'It's borderline illegal': The battle raging on the home care front

image.altText: Illustration of a person sitting below cards and dice that are rising above him

props.synopsis: Chat logs and gambling data show the tactics used by Australian-run online casino Stake to keep one user hooked.

title.children: One player's case against the world's biggest crypto casino

image.altText: A crowd of people gathered with some waving banners and flags while Big Ben looms behind them in the background

props.synopsis: Two of the UK's leading groups for women and girls will stop offering membership to trans women in the aftermath of a Supreme Court ruling.

title.children: Leading groups for UK women and girls to close doors for trans women

image.altText: Toddler in onesie.

props.synopsis: NSW police are urging anyone with information about toddler Jordan Thompson's 2005 death to come forward as they increase the reward on offer.

title.children: Police offer $500k reward for help solving mystery of toddler's fatal overdose

image.altText: Donatella Versace smiles and poses for a photo with five models, all in sparkly silver dresses

props.synopsis: With Prada buying Versace, one of fashion's biggest rivalries is over — and it will be hoping to bring the fellow Italian fashion house back into style.

title.children: Versace excelled at maximalism. Now Prada wants to take it further

image.altText: A fence out the front of a prison that says Yatala Labour Prison.

props.synopsis: In sentencing, the South Australian District Court judge said Paul Andrew Robinson's offending was motivated by an "ultimate aim to make a lot of money".

title.children: Correctional services executive jailed over $300k prison rort

image.altText: A heavily damaged house surrounded by trees.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's government says it will summon eight companies over their suspected role in worsening the scale of floods and landslides that have killed more than 700 people. But environmental groups say authorities are hypocritical and partly to blame for the destruction.

title.children: Palm oil and mining blamed for cyclone devastation in Sumatra

image.altText: Rory McIlroy watches a shot at Australian Open.

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy knows there is room for improvement after his first round at the Australian Open, as the five-time major champion brings spectators flocking to Royal Melbourne.

title.children: McIlroy starts slowly at Australian Open but proves he is the headline act

image.altText: A man with grey hair and grey beard, in a patterned shirt, holding the neck of a guitar, vertically by his head.

props.synopsis: Steve Cropper, was best known as the guitarist for Booker T and the MG's, but also co-wrote the classics Green Onions, and In the Midnight Hour.

title.children: Legendary guitarist and songwriter Steve Cropper dies aged 84

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looking at the camera with a stern expression and furrowed brow.

props.synopsis: A report by the Pentagon watchdog concludes US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated Pentagon policy by using his personal device for official business and recommends better training for all Pentagon officials.

title.children: Hegseth's use of Signal app posed risk to US personnel, watchdog finds

image.altText: aa middle aged man with greying hair and glasses

props.synopsis: A California doctor is imprisoned for illegally supplying Friends sitcom star Matthew Perry with ketamine, the powerful sedative that caused the actor's drug overdose death in 2023.

title.children: Doctor in Matthew Perry overdose case jailed

image.altText: A raccoon is seen passed out on a bathroom floor, in between a black bin and a white toilet.

props.synopsis: The suspect broke into a liquor store in the US state of Virginia, ransacked several shelves and ended up face down in the bathroom.

title.children: Raccoon goes on liquor binge and passes out in toilet

image.altText: Man in front of a microphone gesticulating in a radio studio mid sentence  wearing a black t-shirt.

props.synopsis: A community radio station in Alice Springs is becoming a breeding ground for new, diverse voices by giving people with disability a platform to broadcast.

title.children: People with disability 'blossom like a flower' on community radio
